title: Valērijs Agešins
text:
Valērijs Agešins (born June 23, 1972 in <a href="Liep%C4%81ja">Liepāja</a>) is a <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>n <a href="politician">politician</a> and <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a>. He is a member of <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20%26quot%3BHarmony%26quot%3B">Harmony</a> and a <a href="Deputies%20of%20the%20Saeima">deputy</a> of the <a href="Saeima">Saeima</a>, elected to represent the <a href="Courland">Kurzeme</a> electoral district. He began his current term in parliament on November 4, 2014.
From 1994-1998 he studied at the <a href="Immanuel%20Kant%20Baltic%20Federal%20University">Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University</a> in <a href="Kalinigrad">Kalinigrad</a>, graduating in history. He obtained a master's degree in pedagogy, and in 2002, he graduated from the <a href="Baltic%20International%20Academy">Baltic Russian Institute</a> as a lawyer. He is not however, a qualified <a href="Attorney-at-law">attorney</a>.
From 1997-1998 he worked in a teacher training summer camp and from 1995-1999 as a law and political science lecturer at the Institute of Social Technologies. From 1998-2002 he was a history teacher at <a href="Liep%C4%81ja">Liepāja</a> High School where he was a member of the secondary school teachers' union committee. In 2002 he became a member of the Liepāja City Public Reconciliation Commission, becoming Vice-President. Later in 2002 he was elected to the <a href="Saeima">Saeima</a>, and was re-elected again in 2006. His area of specialization is legal issues, the Parliamentary Justice Committee and the Committee on European Affairs.
He speaks three languages, <a href="Russian%20language">Russian</a>, <a href="Latvian%20language">Latvian</a>, <a href="English%20language">English</a> and enjoys <a href="Association%20football">football</a>, <a href="swimming%20%28sport%29">swimming</a>, <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>.
